alert.note: Alert for Clay; Lowndes; Oktibbeha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 22 at 2:57PM CDT until March 22 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR EASTERN OKTIBBEHA...CLAY AND LOWNDES COUNTIES... At 257 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Trebloc to near Sessums to 8 miles west of Brooksville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Waverly around 310 PM CDT. Columbus AFB around 315 PM CDT. Kolola Springs around 320 PM CDT. Caledonia around 325 PM CDT. Columbus around 330 PM CDT. Steens around 335 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Artesia. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for northeastern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
